name: Introduction
description: In this chapter you learn the basics about this pack. You might as well call it a Tutorial, but a little bit more painful. You do not have to finish all quests to progress, but it is recommended

quests.name: Better Tools
quests.description: As you may notice this pack has no Tinkers' Construct, so currently your only tools are the normal Minecraft ones. Fortunately they seem to be relatively durable. You can make some better tools when you get access to Brass...

tasks.longDescription: Get yourself some stone to make better tools using a wooden pick.
Just get yourself some cobble and sticks
You will stay on the stone level for a little while until you find your first Copper Vein.

quests.name: Mental Support [Hard Choice]
quests.description: Well, you have my mental support for finding the ores. Check out the Tutorial Section of this book for all vein types if you want. Be warned. If you finish this quest, the Useful Support Quest will become unavailable.

tasks.longDescription: Feed me with 10 Pieces of Flint to confirm that you want to choose this quest.

quests.name: You thought this was a smeltery...

tasks.longDescription: Furnaces need a few brick blocks as basis, at least on this stage of the game.
The smeltery controller is the input for solid items into the Smeltery
The Fuel Container for the Smeltery. It currently accepts Lava, Pyrotheum and Hot IC2 Coolant
Your fluid in- and outputs for the smeltery. You can also manually input fluids by clicking on the drain with a filled bucket/tank

tasks.description: Making a Casting Table and Basin
tasks.longDescription: These blocks are used to solidify the fluids casted from the faucets.

quests.name: Welcome to the New Age!
quests.description: As always your first task is to punch some wood. But unlike the other ten thousand times you did that you have to notice that the wood you are punching is quite fragile and not retrieve you any logs.

tasks.longDescription: Your first task is to get yourself some planks and other goodies
Now that you got yourself some wood you can make yourself a crafting table.
To get some Log Blocks you need a tool that stops mashing up wood blocks when you punch them. This, obviously, is an axe.

quests.name: Time To Farm!
quests.description: Farming is something you should definetly work on. Fortunately Spice of Life is configured to be relatively rewarding in this pack, but you should still set up some farms.

tasks.longDescription: Merry Chri... Uh no. But you can farm stuff now. Yay!

quests.name: Jar of Dirt!
quests.description: Sorry we are out of jars, but thanks to your wonderful new shovel you should be able to pick up blocks without punching them to dust.

tasks.longDescription: Pick up some Dirt, Sand and water and convert them to bog earth. Placing it down next to water and it will turn into peat after a while.

quests.name: Useful Support [Easy Choice]
quests.description: Even when you know where to look for the ores, it can be quite difficult to find a vein, isn't it? You can check the Tutorial Chapter of the questbook to find out the best Y Levels for ores. Use this rod wisely, as it will take you some time until you are able to generate mana yourself. Note: Once you complete this quest, the "Mental Support" quest will become unavailable.

tasks.longDescription: Feed me 10 Compressed Sawdust to confirm that you want to choose this reward.

quests.name: By the power of Clayskull!
quests.description: Get yourself some clay. You will need it. To obtain bricks and flower pots you need to create a pottery kiln. Dig a block into the floor, shift right click it with up to 8 clay balls, cover it with a hay bale and a piece of wood. Then just ignite it with a Firestarter and wait a few minutes. Since you will probably need a lot of bricks it is recommended to run multiple kiln pits simultaneously.

tasks.longDescription: Balance
Balance Balance
BALANCEPTION

quests.name: Where dem ores at?
quests.description: you may or may not have noticed that that the overworld is completely free of any ores besides of Petrified Potatoes (don't ask). You will have to travel to the Mining Dimension to get them!

tasks.longDescription: Make yourself some basic stone tools and get some basic materials. Mash them together and you get a mining multitool! This makes total sense, right?
You can use the tool to create portal frame blocks. Form a small portal out of them (similar to a Nether Portal) and use the tool once more to ignite it
Travel to the Mining Dimension to finally be able to obtain ores!

quests.name: Time to mine!
quests.description: Now that you made your first pickaxe you probably want to use it for something, don't you? In this pack the overworld only contains Aluminium Oreberry Bushes and Petrified Potatoes, so you should consider visiting a certain other dimension...

tasks.longDescription: Mine 64 Cobblestone and 32 Slate and feed them to the Questbook.
